alert.note: Alert for Athens (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Athens County through 800 PM EDT... At 730 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Athens, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Athens and Coolville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
